intro: Homalobus bicristatus, commonly known as the two-crowned fern, is a species of fern native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive fronds with two prominent, recurved lobes. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its spores are produced in sori that are clustered on the underside of the fronds. The botanical features of Homalobus bicristatus make it an interesting subject for studies in tropical plant morphology and ecology.
